pr_title: Ease up setting affinity on linux x86_64

timeline.message:
Ease up setting affinity on linux x86_64

Setting the thread affinity with the OpenHFT library requires the
OpenHFT lib to be on the classpath and libffi.so to be loadable too.
This makes the users forced to configure the system to use the affinity
feature. With this change we make this easy for the users running
Hazelcast on Linux x86_64. If not explicitly disabled with
`-Dhazelcast.affinity.lib.disabled=true`, we load our
`libaffinity_helper.so` that we bundle in our OS and EE jar instead of
using the OpenHFT library, therefore, enabling thread affinity on Linux
x86_64 requires no more than just setting the system arguments.
